DataElement.preferredName: Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Date and Time Validation Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action within the context of a given study that is not directly related to the study's overarching hypothesis evaluation or testing, but is nonetheless essential to the efficient and/or effective coordination and execution of the study. EXAMPLE(S): assignment to a treatment arm, registration to a study, start of on-study period, end of on-study period, obtain informed consent, verify eligibility criteria, enroll, randomize, complete study visits, exit study, break treatment blind, protocol violation, premature withdrawal, etc. A coded value specifying the degree of authoritativeness or certiitude of the date of the activity. EXAMPLE(S): date estimated, date greater than 100 days - day is correct, date known, date less than 100 days - date is correct, date previously reported NOTE(S): The concept of "date unknown" is captured by a null flavor of "UNK" on the date range attribute, rather than a code in this attribute.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Date and Time Validation Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The act of validating; finding or testing the truth of something.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.
